pullRequest.body:
From FLT

Co-authored-by: Kevin Buzzard <k.buzzard@imperial.ac.uk>


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [2d1f9ab9e6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19873/commits/2d1f9ab9e660b5ff017d23da90f19c8d7091819e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ det_mulLeft`
`+ det_mulRight`
`+ det_ring`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> Does this generalise to talk about the determinant of the map M -> M given by smul a?

What was the resolution regarding this?

I thought the resolution was your suggestion of stating the result with `mulLeft`. Given that `det_smul` already exists, I don't really see the point of "generalising" (it's not syntactically a generalisation) my result to scalar multiplication.
`LinearMap.det_smul` is about the result of scaling a linear map, not the result of taking the determinant of the map that corresponds to scaling (`DistribMulAction.toLinearMap`).

> `LinearMap.det_smul` is about the result of scaling a linear map, not the result of taking the determinant of the map that corresponds to scaling

Yes, but `(a • ·) = a • id`, right? So you can get one from the other. That was my reasoning
No, the point of my suggestion is that your lemma is about multiplication by an element of R as a map R -> R, whereas I'd like to generalise to multiplication by an element of R as a map M -> M
Yes but that's not a syntactic generalisation, so it would have to be a separate lemma
It would be a separate lemma from which your lemma can be proven directly.
Okay, then which of the 4-5 spellings of this linear map should I be writing it for?
`DistribMulAction.toLinearMap` is the most general one

Okay, and what should it state? Scalar multiplication by a real number `r` has determinant `r` over the reals, but `r ^ 2` over the complex numbers. There is also the issue that the type of `DistribMulAction.toLinearMap` is
```
DistribMulAction.toLinearMap.{u_1, u_3, u_4} (R : Type u_1) {S : Type u_3} (M : Type u_4) [Semiring R] [AddCommMonoid M]
  [Module R M] [Monoid S] [DistribMulAction S M] [SMulCommClass S R M] (s : S) : M →ₗ[R] M
```
meaning that `(DistribMulAction.toLinearMap R M s).det : R` isn't directly comparable to `s : S`
It should be in terms of the finrank, as in `det_smul`
I was going to suggest specializing to `S = R`, but I guess the whole point is to also allow `S = MulOpposite R` which means you get the right multiplication version too.
Yes exactly... and the version for general `R` and `S` should include `Algebra.norm` somewhere per Zulip. At this point, maybe we can call it a day?

How about we add
```lean
/-- When the function is over the base ring, the determinant is the evaluation at 1. -/
@[simp] lemma det_ring (f : R →ₗ[R] R) : f.det = f 1 := by
  classical
  rw [← det_toMatrix ⟨(Finsupp.LinearEquiv.finsuppUnique R R Unit).symm⟩, Matrix.det_unique]
  rfl
```
instead, from which your lemmas follow with `by simp`?
That's a great idea, although I don't really like the name `det_ring`

> I don't really like the name `det_ring`

I chose it given we have `LinearMap.ext_ring`
Does this generalise to talk about the determinant of the map M -> M given by smul a?
[LinearMap.det_smul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Determinant.html#LinearMap.det_smul) assumes Field while it should really assume M is finite free ...
That lemma also suggests that this one is named inconsistently

> [LinearMap.det_smul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Determinant.html#LinearMap.det_smul) assumes Field while it should really assume M is finite free ...

#19885
This lemma should probably be called `det_mulLeft` and stated using `mulLeft`.
Can you add the `mulRight` version too?
Any idea why `(Basis.singleton Unit R)` doesn't work here? Are we missing a simp lemma? Are they defeq?

`Basis.singleton` is defined using `Finsupp.single`, and you know better than anyone else what this means for defeqs

We are certainly missing some simp lemma, since the following works:
```
  classical
  rw [← det_toMatrix (Basis.singleton Unit R), Matrix.det_unique]
  simp [toMatrix]
```

pullRequest.title: feat: determinant of left multiplication

instead, from which your lemmas follow with `by simp`?
